title: How to Make Honeycomb in Cadbury Crunchie

steps.headline: Put sugar, golden syrup and honey into the saucepan!
steps.description: This is sticky so do not spill the materials.

steps.headline: Melt over medium heat.
steps.description: Bring them to the boil and simmer gently for 5 minutes, stirring frequently!

steps.headline: Once the mixture is caramelised (it should turn brown), remove it from the heat!
steps.description: It gets harder to work the longer it is cooked

steps.headline: Mix water and sodium bicarbonate (aka baking soda) and stir very quickly.
steps.description: The baking soda will form the airy layer of the candy.

steps.headline: Watch it turn into a huge orange crunchy foam.
Pour it out into a greased dish and wait for it to cool.
steps.description: Work quickly if you want to use a candy mold to make shaped pieces.

steps.headline: Eat quickly and enjoy.
steps.description: This treat should be eaten within a day, because natural moisture in the air will make it melt and turn sticky. Put in a sealed container to keep the moisture out if it to help keep longer and refrigeration in sealed container can help make it crisper and less sticky.
